The existing code after the TODO already includes downloading 'words' and 'stopwords', but maybe the user missed some required NLTK data for the NER part.

Wait, the code uses ne_chunk from nltk.chunk. For ne_chunk to work, don't we need the 'maxent_ne_chunker' and 'words' datasets? Because ne_chunk relies on a trained model to identify named entities. So the user might have forgotten to download 'maxent_ne_chunker' and 'words' (though 'words' is already in the code). Let me check the NLTK documentation.
